sn22.49:4.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
sn22.49:4.3: Then the householder Soṇa went up to the Buddha …
sn22.49:5.1: “Soṇa, there are ascetics and brahmins who—based on form, which is impermanent, suffering, and perishable—regard themselves thus: ‘I’m better’,
sn22.49:5.4: What is that but a failure to see truly?
sn22.49:5.14: consciousness, which is impermanent, suffering, and perishable, they regard themselves thus: ‘I’m better’,
sn22.49:5.17: What is that but a failure to see truly?
sn22.49:6.1: There are ascetics and brahmins who—based on form, which is impermanent, suffering, and perishable—don’t regard themselves thus: ‘I’m better’,
sn22.49:6.4: What is that but seeing truly?
sn22.49:6.8: consciousness, which is impermanent, suffering, and perishable, they don’t regard themselves thus: ‘I’m better’,
sn22.49:6.11: What is that but seeing truly?
sn22.49:7.1: What do you think, Soṇa? Is form permanent or impermanent?”
sn22.49:7.3: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
sn22.49:7.5: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and perishable, is it fit to be regarded thus:
sn22.49:7.6: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
sn22.49:7.14: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
sn22.49:7.16: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and perishable, is it fit to be regarded thus:
sn22.49:7.17: ‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
sn22.49:8.1: “So, Soṇa, you should truly see any kind of form at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near: all form—with proper wisdom: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
sn22.49:9.1: You should truly see any kind of feeling …
sn22.49:9.4: consciousness at all—past, future, or present; internal or external; coarse or fine; inferior or superior; far or near: all consciousness—with proper wisdom: ‘This is not mine, I am not this, this is not my self.’
sn22.49:10.1: Seeing this, a learned noble disciple becomes disillusioned with form, feeling, perception, choices, and consciousness.
sn22.49:10.4: When freed, they know ‘it is freed’.
sn22.49:10.5: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual life has been lived, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’”
